content:
lug
the violinist are also found in the case of pregnancy due to rape. Further-
more, there are no relevant differences that are important enough to over-
ride the significance of these similarities. These considerations, if correct,
provide a reason for treating the two cases in the same way. If we agree, as
Thomson thinks we will, that it is not wrong to unplug the violinist, then we
have a reason to conclude that abortion after rape is not wrong either.
